alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 11 at 9:45AM PST until January 15 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting South Central Oregon Coast zone. .Abundant moisture will arrive with the next storm system coming in Friday night through Saturday night. During this time 2 to 3 inches of rain will be possible. This will create river rises, including on the Coquille River at Coquille which may reach flood stage. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING TO LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Some farm buildings may be threatened and roads covered in low areas by rising water. Expect widespread flooding throughout the Coquille River floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM PST Thursday the stage was 20.5 feet. - The Coquille River at Coquille is already in action stage, but a break in the heavy precipitation Thursday will allow the river to recede slightly before the next system arrives. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Coquille River Coquille 21.0 20.5 Thu 8 am PST 19.2 18.9 21.9 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM PST.
